region.description: AWS region to query for the metric

namespace.description: A namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics. Metrics in different namespaces are isolated from each other, so that metrics from different applications are not mistakenly aggregated into the same statistics. For example, Amazon EC2 uses the AWS/EC2 namespace.

matchExact.description: Only show metrics that exactly match all defined dimension names.

period.description: The length of time associated with a specific Amazon CloudWatch statistic. Can be specified by a number of seconds, 'auto', or as a duration string e.g. '15m' being 15 minutes

accountId.description: The ID of the AWS account to query for the metric, specifying `all` will query all accounts that the monitoring account is permitted to query.

statistic.description: Metric data aggregations over specified periods of time. For detailed definitions of the statistics supported by CloudWatch, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/Statistics-definitions.html.

Dimensions.description: A name/value pair that is part of the identity of a metric. For example, you can get statistics for a specific EC2 instance by specifying the InstanceId dimension when you search for metrics.

queryMode.description: Whether a query is a Metrics, Logs, or Annotations query

metricQueryType.description: Whether to use a metric search or metric insights query

metricEditorMode.description: Whether to use the query builder or code editor to create the query

id.description: ID can be used to reference other queries in math expressions. The ID can include numbers, letters, and underscore, and must start with a lowercase letter.

label.description: Change the time series legend names using dynamic labels. See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/graph-dynamic-labels.html for more details.

sqlExpression.description: When the metric query type is set to `Insights`, this field is used to specify the query string.

refId.description:
A unique identifier for the query within the list of targets.
In server side expressions, the refId is used as a variable name to identify results.
By default, the UI will assign A->Z; however setting meaningful names may be useful.

hide.description: If hide is set to true, Grafana will filter out the response(s) associated with this query before returning it to the panel.

queryType.description:
Specify the query flavor
TODO make this required and give it a default

region.description: AWS region to query for the metric

namespace.description: A namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics. Metrics in different namespaces are isolated from each other, so that metrics from different applications are not mistakenly aggregated into the same statistics. For example, Amazon EC2 uses the AWS/EC2 namespace.

matchExact.description: Only show metrics that exactly match all defined dimension names.

period.description: The length of time associated with a specific Amazon CloudWatch statistic. Can be specified by a number of seconds, 'auto', or as a duration string e.g. '15m' being 15 minutes

accountId.description: The ID of the AWS account to query for the metric, specifying `all` will query all accounts that the monitoring account is permitted to query.

statistic.description: Metric data aggregations over specified periods of time. For detailed definitions of the statistics supported by CloudWatch, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/Statistics-definitions.html.

sql.description: When the metric query type is set to `Insights` and the `metricEditorMode` is set to `Builder`, this field is used to build up an object representation of a SQL query.

datasource.description:
For mixed data sources the selected datasource is on the query level.
For non mixed scenarios this is undefined.
TODO find a better way to do this ^ that's friendly to schema
TODO this shouldn't be unknown but DataSourceRef | null

CloudWatchMetricsQuery.description: Shape of a CloudWatch Metrics query

select.description: SELECT part of the SQL expression

from.description: FROM part of the SQL expression

where.description: WHERE part of the SQL expression

groupBy.description: GROUP BY part of the SQL expression

orderBy.description: ORDER BY part of the SQL expression

orderByDirection.description: The sort order of the SQL expression, `ASC` or `DESC`

limit.description: LIMIT part of the SQL expression

operator.description: TS type is operator: QueryEditorOperator<QueryEditorOperatorValueType>, extended in veneer

QueryEditorOperator.description: TS type is QueryEditorOperator<T extends QueryEditorOperatorValueType>, extended in veneer

queryMode.description: Whether a query is a Metrics, Logs, or Annotations query

region.description: AWS region to query for the logs

expression.description: The CloudWatch Logs Insights query to execute

statsGroups.description: Fields to group the results by, this field is automatically populated whenever the query is updated

refId.description:
A unique identifier for the query within the list of targets.
In server side expressions, the refId is used as a variable name to identify results.
By default, the UI will assign A->Z; however setting meaningful names may be useful.

hide.description: If hide is set to true, Grafana will filter out the response(s) associated with this query before returning it to the panel.

queryType.description:
Specify the query flavor
TODO make this required and give it a default

queryLanguage.description: Language used for querying logs, can be CWLI, SQL, or PPL. If empty, the default language is CWLI.

datasource.description:
For mixed data sources the selected datasource is on the query level.
For non mixed scenarios this is undefined.
TODO find a better way to do this ^ that's friendly to schema
TODO this shouldn't be unknown but DataSourceRef | null

CloudWatchLogsQuery.description: Shape of a CloudWatch Logs query

queryMode.description: Whether a query is a Metrics, Logs, or Annotations query

prefixMatching.description: Enable matching on the prefix of the action name or alarm name, specify the prefixes with actionPrefix and/or alarmNamePrefix

actionPrefix.description:
Use this parameter to filter the results of the operation to only those alarms
that use a certain alarm action. For example, you could specify the ARN of
an SNS topic to find all alarms that send notifications to that topic.
e.g. `arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:my-app-` would match `arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:my-app-action`
but not match `arn:aws:sns:us-east-1:123456789012:your-app-action`

refId.description:
A unique identifier for the query within the list of targets.
In server side expressions, the refId is used as a variable name to identify results.
By default, the UI will assign A->Z; however setting meaningful names may be useful.

hide.description: If hide is set to true, Grafana will filter out the response(s) associated with this query before returning it to the panel.

queryType.description:
Specify the query flavor
TODO make this required and give it a default

region.description: AWS region to query for the metric

namespace.description: A namespace is a container for CloudWatch metrics. Metrics in different namespaces are isolated from each other, so that metrics from different applications are not mistakenly aggregated into the same statistics. For example, Amazon EC2 uses the AWS/EC2 namespace.

matchExact.description: Only show metrics that exactly match all defined dimension names.

period.description: The length of time associated with a specific Amazon CloudWatch statistic. Can be specified by a number of seconds, 'auto', or as a duration string e.g. '15m' being 15 minutes

accountId.description: The ID of the AWS account to query for the metric, specifying `all` will query all accounts that the monitoring account is permitted to query.

statistic.description: Metric data aggregations over specified periods of time. For detailed definitions of the statistics supported by CloudWatch, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/Statistics-definitions.html.

alarmNamePrefix.description:
An alarm name prefix. If you specify this parameter, you receive information
about all alarms that have names that start with this prefix.
e.g. `my-team-service-` would match `my-team-service-high-cpu` but not match `your-team-service-high-cpu`

datasource.description:
For mixed data sources the selected datasource is on the query level.
For non mixed scenarios this is undefined.

TODO this shouldn't be unknown but DataSourceRef | null

CloudWatchAnnotationQuery.description:
Shape of a CloudWatch Annotation query
TS type is CloudWatchDefaultQuery = Omit<CloudWatchLogsQuery, 'queryMode'> & CloudWatchMetricsQuery, declared in veneer
#CloudWatchDefaultQuery: #CloudWatchLogsQuery & #CloudWatchMetricsQuery @cuetsy(kind="type")
